Conversation: Copyright Violation DMCA Notice CEASE & DESIST:
weddinginvitations.be
Subject: Copyright Violation DMCA Notice CEASE & DESIST:
weddinginvitations.be
Importance: High



ATTN: George Poletes, Corporate Counsel

1333 Stemmons Freeway, Suite 110, Dallas, TX 75207

(214) 782-7756

 

 Hello ThePlanet Abuse & Copyright Infringement Teams, Please forward
this urgent notice of copyright theft about one of your users to your
legal counsel immediately.

 

Please assist us in this urgent matter concerning a fraudulent website
you are hosting called http://www.weddinginvitations.be/winatrip.htm.
This site on your servers has copied and pasted our site contents and
intellectual property from one of our ConsumerNet, Inc. family of web
sites, called BridalTips.com.  They may have also copied content from
other web sites, and we'll be notifying the legal counsel of those
affected sites as well. It was brought to our attention by some visitors
to our website.

 

The offending web site is located at IP address 69.93.118.179


Network Whois record


Queried whois.arin.net with "69.93.118.179"...

OrgName:    ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc. 
OrgID:      TPCM
Address:    1333 North Stemmons Freeway
Address:    Suite 110
City:       Dallas
StateProv:  TX
PostalCode: 75207
 
    

Pursuant to the Digital Millennium Copyright act, I have a good faith
belief that use of the material in the manner complained of is not
authorized by the copyright owner (ConsumerNet, Inc.), its agent, or the
law. The information in this notification is accurate, and under penalty
of perjury, that I am authorized to act on behalf of our exclusive right
that is allegedly infringed. 

 

It is more than obvious they copied content from our site, you can see
we have been online since 1997, many years longer than your customer.

 

We are asking you to remove the itemized offending pages off your
servers because their site is created in bad faith, stealing our
copyright content and publishing to the world as their own, and stealing
traffic from our web site in the process.

 

Google Search Query (use quotes a shown):
The copyrighted work at issue is the text that appears on our home page
at http://www.bridaltips.com/dj.htm.  This is a unique sentence off our
guide that we used to search Google to see who stole our content:

 

"There are thousands of wedding disc jockeys!"


 

Problem Description:

What we found is an illegal scraper site, who along with 2 other scraper
sites, has copied our content, and used it to feed to Google's crawler
to out rank our own web site.

 

EXAMPLES:

Here is a screen shot of Google which will demonstrate that the
offending scammers stole from our site to create their scraper site.  We
grabbed this sentence from OUR site below to Google it:



 

On our web site page at http://www.bridaltips.com/dj.htm we have this
paragraph below:

There are thousands of wedding disc jockeys! But how do you find the
wedding disc jockey that's perfect for you? Here you'll find all the
caveats to avoid, questions to ask, what DJ equipment they should be
using, and what you should have included in your contract. Many tips on
this page are only our opinion, you must choose what you feel is right
for your wedding.

 

On the scammer's web site at 
http://www.weddinginvitations.be/winatrip.htm  you can clearly see they
cut and pasted our content at the top of their page to steal our ranking
in order to sell wedding initiations.



 

You can see on the Google search results page that our sentence in bold
shows up exactly in the descriptions of the offending scraper site.
They have scraped our content and are feeding it to Google's crawler.

Of course it's a scam setup to attract users intended to visit our site,
where the scammers hope the visitors will click on the sponsored ads or
buy their products to generate revenue.  This is in violation of Google
policies also.

A unique sentence off on our web site should not produce results from
other web sites.

It appears they have cut and pasted our in an attempt to hurt our
ratings in Google, while pumping up their own ratings using stolen
copyrighted materials.

We do not allow any other sites to use our content, and this is strictly
enforced. They do not have permission to use our information.  We can go
on and on all day long finding groups of sentences that they stole off
our site, but we proved our point.  

I have a good faith belief that use of the copyrighted materials
described above as allegedly infringing is not authorized by the
copyright owner, its agent, or the law. I swear, under penalty of
perjury, that the information in the notification is accurate and that I
am the copyright owner or am authorized to act on behalf of the owner of
an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed.

 

Also, should these scammers lie to you and attempt to claim this content
is their authorship, you can verify their false claims ahead of time
yourself on the Internet Archive Wayback Machine at archive.org.  Our
site shows entries dating back to 1998, while the offending site doesn't
have much of any history before 2004.  We suspect they stole our content
fairly recently when we were rated in the top 10 Google search results
for many popular wedding keywords.

 

 

Also, should these scammers lie to you and attempt to claim this content
is their authorship, you can verify their false claims ahead of time
yourself on the Internet Archive Wayback Machine at archive.org.  Our
site shows entries dating back to 1998, while the offending site doesn't
have anything.  They did this in an apparent attempt to outrank us in
Google and steal traffic intended for out web site.

 

We have our entire site on file in the Library Of Congress in Washington
DC.  We catch sites like this one every week who decide the copyright
laws don't apply to them. If we have to go to court to get this site
shut down, it should be pretty easy to demonstrate we are the owners of
the site content, and even easier to recoup losses and attorney fees.

 

We invite you to ask your customer about their Copyright and Trademark
registrations, I'm sure you'll up empty handed.

 

The Library Of Congress can send over a CDROM to the court with our
copyright content to prove that we are the rightful owners of the name
and the content.  We have already started printing out their site and
passed it on to our legal counsel, and will very easily find out what
other auto sites they stole from and notify them as well.  

 

We hope you will respond quickly to do what is moral and help us stop
these scammers in their place.  All they are doing is tainting the
internet experience for everyone, including your company, creating a
dangerously large liability for you in court should you not react to
this DMCA, and taunting you by breaking the rules of your registration
agreement. Please shut down this site immediately, until such time that
they have removed all the content that they have plagiarized from other
sites. We will vigorously defend our position against them in federal
court if necessary.  We appreciate your cooperation in this matter.

 

Please call me at (954) 755-4094 as soon as possible to discuss your
plans to remove this site off your servers.

 

Best Regards,

 

 



/Jeff Ostroff/
